intro: Sarcodraba karr-aikensis, commonly known as the Karr-aikens rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, showy flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It typically grows in rocky soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Its blooming period occurs during the warmer months, adding a splash of color to its natural habitat.
